title: Twelve flags south
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Mawson, Douglas, Sir, 1882-1958
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Antarctica - Discovery and exploration
Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Byrd, Richard Evelyn, 1888-1957
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Motion pictures - Archival resources
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/International cooperation
description: A documentary on international co-operation in Antarctica among twelve nations - signatories to the Antarctica treaty, which has "frozen" all territorial claims in the continent leaving it a vast laboratory for peaceful exploration and research. The tour includes travelling with the US convoy through pack ice en route to McMurdo station; visiting the Russian base at Mirny and the US base at the South Pole; scientists of many lands working on upper atmosphere research and exploring caves; New Zealand explorers with dog-sledges, Americans in sno-cats, and finally historic films of early explorers Shackleton, Mawson and Byrd.
